summary: User asks whether the PHP SDK can work standalone without RoadRunner for launching workflows and receiving activities. Initial attempts to connect directly to Temporal server fail with protocol errors.
userImpact: Users with existing PHP stacks need to know if they can use Temporal SDK as a standalone client or if RoadRunner is a hard dependency.
rootCause: Early SDK version required RoadRunner for communication; later versions added gRPC support but with caveats around worker implementation
proposedFix: Support launching workflows from PHP without RoadRunner by using gRPC endpoints directly; eventually provide Java-like Workflow and Activity clients with better abstraction
workaround: Use proto-generated PHP gRPC client directly instead of the SDK wrapper
resolutionDetails: SDK evolved to support gRPC-based WorkflowService for launching workflows without RoadRunner; workers still require supervisor but client-only use cases are supported
keyQuote: a recent version of WorkflowService uses GRPC and does not require RoadRunner to work (but it does require php-grpc extension)
